Subject: Web 
Software: CSS 
Author: Val Head 


CSS animation offers a whole new way to bring motion to interactive projects. It's a core skill for web designers and developers and a feature users have come to expect from modern websites. This course presents a series of basic CSS animation projects: site features such as rollover buttons, 3D transforms, animated graphics and logos, load screens, and more.â€¨â€¨Web designer Val Head introduces CSS transforms and transitionsâ€”the foundation of most CSS animationsâ€”and shows how to keyframe simple animations and adjust their timing, fill, and direction. She also covers looping and chaining animations, animating HTML and SVG elements, and optimizing animation performance, and introduces the best tools and use cases for CSS animation. Start watching to get your brand in motion.
Topics include:
	â€¢	Using CSS transforms and transitions
	â€¢	Working with animation-delay and animation-fill-mode
	â€¢	Timing and easing CSS animations
	â€¢	Animating elements in place
	â€¢	Animating sprite images
	â€¢	Animating CSS transforms and transitions
	â€¢	Chaining multiple animations
	â€¢	Animating SVG images
	â€¢	Creating high-performance CSS animations
